item.title: Recent advances in extreme value theory
item.description: Recent advances in extreme value theory Thursday, April 20th, 6:00 PT / 9:00 ET / 15:00 CET Extreme value theory is concerned with the accurate statistical assessment of the risk of rare events. Such extreme events have small occurrence probabilities but often entail large economic and ecological costs in addition to their potential for severe impacts on human health. There is active research to model and infer complex extremal dependence structures in multivariate data, with connections to high-dimensional statistics, machine learning and other fields.
